conclusion: Analyzing a circuit with a power source and light bulb using U-I graph.
Line A represents a power source (straight line) and Curve B represents a small light bulb.
The intersection point of A and B shows the operating point of the circuit when connected.
Lines A and B intersect at approximately I = 2 A (current) and U = 2 V (voltage).
The operating point when the power source and light bulb form a closed circuit is I = 2 A and U = 2 V.
Calculate output power: P_output = U * I = 2 V * 2 A = 4 W.
For the power source (line A), the open-circuit voltage is approximately 3 V (y-intercept) and the short-circuit current is approximately 6 A (x-intercept).
Calculate total power of the power source: P_total = open-circuit voltage * operating current = 3 V * 2 A = 6 W.
Alternatively, calculate total power: P_total = EMF * I = 3 V * 2 A = 6 W.
Final answer: Output power is 4 watts and total power of the power source is 6 watts.
